Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to meet work experience requirements for work permit
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer reasonably concluded the applicant lacked required work experience for a cook position
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant had relevant certifications but no prior cooking experience; job required three years of food service experience as per LMO
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the refusal decision
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national applying for temporary work permit
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Visa officer assessed applicant's qualifications and denied application based on insufficient experience
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Allegation that the decision was unreasonable or not in accordance with procedural fairness
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decisions
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Lack of three years of documented cooking experience
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, s. 200(3)(a)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Compliance with procedural fairness in assessment
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not applicable – no finding of misrepresentation, only lack of qualifying experience
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, s. 200(3)(a)
Crimes.Application_Basis: Requirement to demonstrate ability to perform the job of a cook as defined by employer and LMO
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Certifications were considered but outweighed by absence of required work experience
Crimes.Governing_Rule: An officer must not issue a work permit if there are reasonable grounds to believe the foreign national cannot perform the required work
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Absence of verifiable three-year cooking experience
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Visa Officer, Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC)
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No harm established due to lawful application of regulatory requirements
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant did not meet the minimum work experience requirement for the occupation despite other qualifications
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer reviewed submitted documents and determined experience requirement unmet
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, s. 200(3)(a)
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No dispute over authenticity; issue was sufficiency of evidence to meet experience threshold
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Not applicable – application was for temporary work, not permanent residency
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Absent – refusal based on eligibility, not fraud
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, s. 200(3)(a)
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration-related judicial reviews
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer reasonably concluded applicant could not perform the job based on lack of experience
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Three years of experience was a key condition in the LMO and essential to job performance
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Visa Officer at Canadian visa office
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: None identified – decision based on clear gap in required experience

Crimes.Crime_Name: Work Permit Refusal under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer reasonably refused the work permit due to lack of required experience
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of administrative immigration decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: No adverse finding on credibility; refusal based on objective criteria
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, s. 200(3)(a)
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Applicant met most qualifications except three years of cooking experience
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Absence of three years of verifiable cooking experience
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, s. 200(3)(a)
Crimes.Application_Error: None found – officer correctly applied regulatory standards
Crimes.Application_Factor: Experience requirement specified in LMO was binding
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Was the officer’s interpretation and application of experience requirements reasonable?
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: An officer must not issue a work permit if there are reasonable grounds to believe the foreign national cannot perform the required work
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to meet three-year cooking experience requirement despite meeting education and language criteria
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, s. 200(3)(a)
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: No issues with evidence submission or authenticity
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process found to be procedurally fair
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Not present – applicant’s submissions were accepted as truthful
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on reasonableness of interpretation of experience requirement
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, s. 200(3)(a)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Allegation of unfair assessment, but no procedural breach found
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to provide sufficient proof of work experience
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Not applicable – refusal was on eligibility, not inadmissibility
